title: is​
content: </> Connection.is(obj: any) → bool Returns whether or not the passed argument is a connection or not

title: disconnect​
content: </> Connection:disconnect() → () Disconnects the connection from the parent signal and sets connected to false

title: destroy​
content: </> Connection:destroy() → () Disconnects the connection and sets the destroyed field to true

title: new​
content: </> Keeper.new() → () Creates a new Keeper object

title: is​
content: </> Keeper.is(obj: any) → bool Checks whether or not the passed argument is a Keeper instance or not

title: getCard​
content: </> Keeper:getCard(key: any) → Card | nil Gets the card from the key

title: addCard​
content: </> Keeper:addCard( key: any, value?: any ) → Card Creates the card and fires keyAdded or throws if it exists

title: removeCard​
content: </> Keeper:removeCard(key: any) → Card Removes the key and fires keyRemoved or throws if it doesn't exist

title: destroy​
content: </> Keeper:destroy() → nil Destroys the keeper and sets destroyed field to true (preps for garbage collection)

title: new​
content: </> Signal.new() → Signal Constructs a new signal object.

title: is​
content: </> Signal.is(obj: any) → boolean Returns whether the passed argument is a signal

title: enableQueueing​
content: </> Signal:enableQueueing() → nil Enables argumenting queuing from fire calls when there are no connections and sets queueing to true

title: disableQueueing​
content: </> Signal:disableQueueing() → nil Disables argumenting queuing from fire calls when there are no connections and sets queueing to false

title: enableDeferred​
content: </> Signal:enableDeferred() → nil Enables deferred signaling and sets deferred to true

title: disableDeferred​
content: </> Signal:disableDeferred() → nil Disables deferred signaling and sets deferred to false

title: setActivatedCallback​
content: </> Signal:setActivatedCallback(fn: function) → nil Sets the callback that is called when a connection is made from when there are no connections (an activated state enters).

title: setDeactivatedCallback​
content: </> Signal:setDeactivatedCallback(fn: function) → nil Sets the callback that is called when the last active connection is disconnected (a deactivated state enters).

title: fire​
content: </> Signal:fire(...: any) → nil Fires the signal with the optional passed arguments. This method makes optimizations by recycling threads in cases where connections don't yield if deferred is false.

title: flush​
content: </> Signal:flush() → nil Empties any queued arguments that may have been added when fire was called with no connections.

title: wait​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> Signal:wait() → any Yields the current thread until the signal is fired and returns what was fired

title: promise​
content: </> Signal:promise() → Promise Wraps a wait call in a promise. This is preferred over calling wait directly.

title: connect​
content: </> Signal:connect(fn: function) → Connection Connects a handler function to the signal so that it can be called when it's fired.

title: disconnectAll​
content: </> Signal:disconnectAll() → nil Disconnects all connections

title: destroy​
content: </> Signal:destroy() → nil Disconnects all connections and sets the "destroyed" field to true

title: new​
content: </> Card.new(initial: any) → () Creates a new Card object

title: is​
content: </> Card.is(obj: any) → bool Checks whether or not the passed arg is a card

title: setDepth​
content: </> Card:setDepth(depth: number) → () Sets how much history is tracked and removes any excess if the history size exceeds the depth

title: getDepth​
content: </> Card:getDepth() → () Gets the depth of the card

title: getHistory​
content: </> Card:getHistory() → () Gets the history of the card depending on the card's depth

title: getReducedSignal​
content: </> Card:getReducedSignal(reducer: string) → Signal Gets the signal that will be fired for a reducer if it's dispatched

title: getChangedSignal​
content: </> Card:getChangedSignal() → Signal Gets the signal that will be fired if the value changes

title: setReducers​
content: </> Card:setReducers(reducers: table) → nil Sets the reducers for the key (should typically only be set once when the Key is instantiated)

title: rawset​
content: </> Card:rawset(value: any) → nil Sets the value without triggering any signals or history updates

title: get​
content: </> Card:get() → any Gets the current value

title: dispatch​
content: </> Card:dispatch( reducer: string, ...: any ) → nil Dispatches the current reducer to update the value while firing the changed and appropriate reduced signal

title: destroy​
content: </> Card:destroy() → () Destroys the card by prepping for garbage collection

title: new​
content: </> Store.new() → () Creates a new Store object

title: is​
content: </> Store.is(obj: any) → bool Returns whether or not the passed argument is a store object

title: setDepth​
content: </> Store:setDepth(depth: number) → () Sets how much history is tracked and removes any excess if the history size exceeds the depth

title: getDepth​
content: </> Store:getDepth() → number Gets the depth of the store

title: getHistory​
content: </> Store:getHistory() → table Gets the history of the store as a table

title: rawset​
content: </> Store:rawset( key: any, value: any ) → () Sets the state key to the value without firing any events (should be used to initialize the store)

title: rawsetState​
content: </> Store:rawsetState(state: table) → () Sets the state of the store without firing any events (should be used to initialize the store)

title: setReducers​
content: </> Store:setReducers(reducers: table) → nil Sets the reducers for the store

title: get​
content: </> Store:get(key: any) → () Gets the value of the key in the store

title: getState​
content: </> Store:getState() → table Returns the state of the store

title: dispatch​
content: </> Store:dispatch( key: any, reducer: string, ...: any ) → () Dispatches args to the reducer for a key

title: getReducedSignal​
content: </> Store:getReducedSignal( key: any, reducer: any ) → Signal Returns a reduced signal that will be fired if that reducer is used on the key

title: getChangedSignal​
content: </> Store:getChangedSignal(key: any) → Signal Returns a signal that will be fired if the passed key value is changed

title: destroy​
content: </> Store:destroy() → () Cleans up the store object and sets destroyed field to true
